New Hel.fi

Citizen-centric renewal of the largest website in Finland

Services

UX/UI, Development

Client

City of Helsinki

Year

2020-2022

Background

The city of Helsinki's hel.fi was serving as one of the largest websites in Finland. However, it needed a comprehensive renewal to meet modern web standards and user expectations.

Challenge

The challenge was to create a user-friendly and accessible website that could serve the diverse needs of Helsinki's citizens while maintaining a cohesive brand identity.

Approach

Translating the Helsinki brand into a digital experience

We focused on translating the Helsinki brand into a digital experience that resonates with users. This involved extensive user research, prototyping, and iterative design processes.

{/* Add more content about the approach */}

Solution

The new Hel.fi website features a clean, modern design that prioritizes user experience and accessibility. Key features include:

  • Responsive design for seamless use across devices
  • Improved navigation and search functionality
  • Integration of city services and information
    • {/* Add more solution points */}

"This new website has truly elevated the user experience for our citizens. It's a testament to the power of good design and thoughtful development."

- Jan Vapaavuori, Mayor of Helsinki

Selected projects

{/* Add project cards here */}
); } export default CaseStudyHel;
